Research Assistant to Dr. Meghan Gillen (March 2012-May 2014)
Administered surveys to student participants, including obtaining consent and debriefing

Senior Thesis – Tan Bias: Perceptions of Tan and Non-tan Faces (August 2013-April 2014)
Presented findings at the annual EPA conference in Boston, MA
Completed a project analyzing research done on perceptions of tan vs. non-tan people
Worked under Dr. Meghan Gillen, and completed an ACURA project and presentation on the thesis
Researched studies focused on the perception of tan skin
Analyzed perceptions of beauty, fitness, friendliness, intelligence, popularity, and health; and found that all
perception variables except for intelligence showed a significant positive correlation to tan-ness

text.i: Research Assistant to Dr. Meghan Gillen

page.text: Assisted Dr. Gillen on a study researching body image in college students
Administered surveys to classes of students, giving specific instructions to collect reliable data
Presented findings at a poster fair, and answered questions from faculty, staff, and students
Abington Memorial Hospital, Abington PA

Visited patients and spent quality time listening to them and forming relationships
Prevented delirium and losses in functioning for elderly patients, many suffering from memory impairment
Gained valuable knowledge about Alzheimer’s, delirium, and various medical and psychological conditions
